result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Pierre Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**********03-25-15/ Mel Flanagan*********
The Court ordered the JOC amended  by removing the language "consecutive to 13CF2329."

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, including DV surcharge and DNA surcharge, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, and if not paid, during period of extended supervision and convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" counseling and continue programming.
- Attend and complete parenting classes.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No contact with victim, Renee B., until the completion of BIP counseling. Agent must agree that contact is safe and must be Non-violent.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

cf
Bail Notice mailed to surety on 02/19/2015.

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Renee B. 

AS TO CHARGE: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2013CF2329), with credit for 35 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Renee B., 
   until the completion of BIP counseling.  
   Agent must agree that contact is safe 
   and must be non-violent.    
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, including DV surcharge & DNA surcharge, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, and if not paid during period of extended supervision to convert to a civil judgment.  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not received by defense counsel).  mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.  mld
from Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Deborah Collins, Psy.D., ABPP, dated 1-19-2015, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
 Case recalled.  Plea to be entered by defendant. 
AS TO CHARGE: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 2-10-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Parties are not requesting a PSI.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with court liason officer, Rosemarie Galindo.
P.M. 
Competency Hearing proceeded.  Parties stipulate to qualifications of Dr. Collins, to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State: Dr. Deborah Collins.  Testimony closed.  Upon the testimony of Dr. Collins, Court finds that the defendant is competent to proceed.

Jury in box.  Trial resumed.  Sworn for the State, Milwaukee County DA Investigator Anna Linden.  Exhibit 12 and 13 offered and received.  Exhibit 13 is published to the jury.  The jury out of the box.  State rests subject to rebuttal.   Defense Motion for Dismissal w/o argument is heard and denied by the Court.  Brief recess taken.   mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with court liason officer, Rosemarie Galindo.
A.M.
Defense is raising competency.  The Court has arranged defendant to be evaluated over the noon hour by Dr. Deborah Collins.  

Jury in box.  Trial resumed with previously sworn: Milwaukee Police Detective Rosemarie Galindo, on direct examination.  Witness resworn.  Exhibit 1 received.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Aileene Chovanec.  Exhibit 11 offered and received.  Court recessed for lunch.   mld
Based on the conduct of defendant, Court ordered that the cash bail, originally increased to $10,000.00, be doubled to $20,000.00.   mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with court liason officer, Rosemarie Galindo.
P.M.
Sidebar placed on the record, regarding a potential threat by defendant to a witness on the case, dated 1-12-2015.  Court heard and granted motion of the State for increased cash bail on case 2014CF718 in the amount of $10,000.00.   Court heard and denied motion of Attorney Patrick Rupich to withdraw as counsel.  

New Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued at the hour of 3:00 pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of the box.  In chambers discussions, including strikes for cause, are placed on the record.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  

Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective Rosemarie Galindo.  Exhibit 1 offered and received.  Exhibits 2 through 10 offered into evidence and received.  Exhibits 2 through 10 is published to the jury.  Jury out of the box.  Trial to resume on 1-14-2015 at 9:30 am, in branch 4.   

Outside the presence of the jury, Court admonished defendant based on his behavior in the Courtroom.  Based on the behavior of defendant, Court ordered that cash bail be increased from $10,000.00 to $20,000.00 on case 2014CF718.  mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin with court liason officer, Rosemarie Galindo.
A.M.
State had concerns about the defendant and his associates, having contact with several members of the jury panel, by the set of elevators, on the evening of 1-12-2015.  Statement made by Milwaukee Police Officer Rosemarie Galindo.  For the reasons as stated on the record, and following the statement of Milwaukee Police Officer Rosemarie Galindo, jury panel was released by the Court.  New jury panel to be ordered.  Case passed.   

Case recalled.  Same parties.  NEW Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:00 am.   Court recessed for lunch.    mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 3:00 pm.  Voir dire continued to 1-13-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.  State's Motion for Forfeiture by Wrong Doing is heard and granted by the Court.  Case passed.   mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  The State previously filed a Motion for Forfeiture by Wrong Doing.  Case passed.   mld
from the State to the Defendant's Response, received and filed.   mld
Defendant's Brief in Opposition to State's Motion to Admit Renee Baxster's Statement Under Forfeiture by Wrongdoing.

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich (via telephonics).  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense counsel appeared via telephonics due to illness.  Response by defense to State's Forfeiture Motion by Wrongdoing is due by 12-12-2014.  Any response by defense counsel after 12-12-2014, will not be accepted per the Court.  The Court admonished defendant for being late.  Court does not raise the cash bail, as requested by the State, but warned defendant that any further violations will result in the issuance of a bench warrant.  State's offer is now revoked.   Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 1-12-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 The Hon. Dennis Flynn for the Hon. Mel Flanagan.
Court heard and granted the Motion of the State to Adjourn Jury Trial.  Court adjourned State's Motion to Admit Statement for Hearing in Branch 4 on 12-9-2014 at 8:30 am.  Defense response to State's Motion is due by 9-22-2014.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 1-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
from the State to Admit Renee B., Statement Under Forfeiture by Wrongdoing, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick J Rupich.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case recalled.  State is proceeding to trial on another matter, therefore, Court grants trial adjournment to the State.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 9-8-2014 at 8:30 am.  mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick J Rupich.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Case passed.   mld

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick J Rupich.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense has received all discovery.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-16-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail motion by the state argued and denied by the Court.  Bail remains as set.

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Patrick J. Rupich.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  DA Investigator Anna Linden.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 13CF2329 and 14CF218 joined for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Renee B

Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Carlos Pierre Davis in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary Hearing to be heard by Judge Dallet for Judge Flanagan.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
